intro: Echites crassinodus, commonly known as the broad-lobed echites, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves with broad, lobed foliage. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbel-like clusters. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
